revised_title: Liquefaction and Solidification of Argon: Experimental Findings
tldr: The author conducted experiments on the liquefaction and solidification of argon, a newly discovered gas. They determined the critical temperature and pressure of argon, its boiling and freezing points, and its density at various states. The author found that argon has a higher density than other permanent gases and can be solidified, making it an interesting addition to the study of gas properties.
